packages.name: com.vmware.cis
packages.documentation: The {@name com.vmware.cis} {@term package} provides VMware common infrastructure {@term services}.

services.name: com.vmware.cis.session
services.documentation:
The {@name Session} {@term service} allows API clients to manage session tokens including creating, deleting and obtaining information about sessions.

  • The {@link #create} {@term operation} creates session token in exchange for another authentication token.
  • The {@link #delete} {@term operation} invalidates a session token.
  • The {@link #get} retrieves information about a session token.

The call to the {@link #create} {@term operation} is part of the overall authentication process for API clients. For example, the sequence of steps for establishing a session with SAML token is:

  • Connect to lookup service.
  • Discover the secure token service (STS) endpoint URL.
  • Connect to the secure token service to obtain a SAML token.
  • Authenticate to the lookup service using the obtained SAML token.
  • Discover the API endpoint URL from lookup service.
  • Call the {@link #create} {@term operation}. The {@link #create} call must include the SAML token.

See the programming guide and samples for additional information about establishing API sessions.

Execution Context and Security Context

To use session based authentication a client should supply the session token obtained through the {@link #create} {@term operation}. The client should add the session token in the security context when using SDK classes. Clients using the REST API should supply the session token using the {@code vmware-api-session-id} HTTP header field.

Session Lifetime

A session begins with call to the {@link #create} {@term operation} to exchange a SAML token for a API session token. A session ends under the following circumstances:

  • Call to the {@link #delete} {@term operation}.
  • The session expires. Session expiration may be caused by one of the following situations:
    • Client inactivity - For a particular session identified by client requests that specify the associated session ID, the lapsed time since the last request exceeds the maximum interval between requests.
    • Unconditional or absolute session expiration time: At the beginning of the session, the session logic uses the SAML token and the system configuration to calculate absolute expiration time.

When a session ends, the authentication logic will reject any subsequent client requests that specify that session. Any operations in progress will continue to completion.

Error Handling

The {@link Session} returns the following {@term errors}:

  • {@link Unauthenticated} {@term error} for any {@term errors} related to the request.
  • {@link ServiceUnavailable} {@term error} for all {@term errors} caused by internal service failure.

structures.name: com.vmware.cis.session.info
structures.documentation: Represents data associated with an API session.

fields.name: user
fields.documentation: Fully qualified name of the end user that created the session, for example Administrator@vsphere.local. A typical use case for this information is in Graphical User Interfaces (GUI) or logging systems to visualize the identity of the current user.

fields.name: created_time
fields.documentation: Time when the session was created.

fields.name: last_accessed_time
fields.documentation: Last time this session was used by passing the session token for invoking an API.

operations.name: create
operations.documentation:
Creates a session with the API. This is the equivalent of login. This {@term operation} exchanges user credentials supplied in the security context for a session token that is to be used for authenticating subsequent calls.

To authenticate subsequent calls clients are expected to include the session token. For REST API calls the HTTP {@code vmware-api-session-id} header field should be used for this.

result.documentation: Newly created session token to be used for authenticating further requests.

errors.documentation:
if the session creation fails due to request specific issues. Due to the security nature of the API the details of the error are not disclosed.

Please check the following preconditions if using a SAML token to authenticate:

  • the supplied token is delegate-able.
  • the time of client and server system are synchronized.
  • the token supplied is valid.
  • if bearer tokens are used check that system configuration allows the API endpoint to accept such tokens.

if session creation fails due to server specific issues, for example connection to a back end component is failing. Due to the security nature of this API further details will not be disclosed in the {@term error}. Please refer to component health information, administrative logs and product specific documentation for possible causes.

operations.name: delete
operations.documentation:
Terminates the validity of a session token. This is the equivalent of log out.

A session token is expected as part of the request.

errors.documentation: if the session id is missing from the request or the corresponding session object cannot be found.

if session deletion fails due to server specific issues, for example connection to a back end component is failing. Due to the security nature of this API further details will not be disclosed in the {@term error}. Please refer to component health information, administrative logs and product specific documentation for possible causes.

operations.name: get
operations.documentation:
Returns information about the current session. This {@term operation} expects a valid session token to be supplied.

A side effect of invoking this {@term operation} may be a change to the session's last accessed time to the current time if this is supported by the session implementation. Invoking any other {@term operation} in the API will also update the session's last accessed time.

This API is meant to serve the needs of various front end projects that may want to display the name of the user. Examples of this include various web based user interfaces and logging facilities.

errors.documentation: if the session id is missing from the request or the corresponding session object cannot be found.

if session retrieval fails due to server specific issues e.g. connection to back end component is failing. Due to the security nature of this API further details will not be disclosed in the error. Please refer to component health information, administrative logs and product specific documentation for possible causes.

services.name: com.vmware.cis.tasks
services.documentation: The {@name Tasks} {@term service} provides {@term operations} for managing the task related to a long running operation.

structures.name: com.vmware.cis.tasks.get_spec
structures.documentation: The {@name GetSpec} {@term structure} describes what data should be included when retrieving information about a task.

fields.name: return_all
fields.documentation: If true, all data, including operation-specific data, will be returned, otherwise only the data described in {@link Info} will be returned.

fields.name: exclude_result
fields.documentation: If true, the result will not be included in the task information, otherwise it will be included.

structures.name: com.vmware.cis.tasks.filter_spec
structures.documentation:
The {@name FilterSpec} {@term structure} contains {@term fields} used to filter the results when listing tasks (see {@link #list}). If multiple {@term fields} are specified, only tasks matching all of the {@term fields} match the filter.

Currently at least one of {@link FilterSpec#tasks} or {@link FilterSpec#services} must be specified and not empty.

fields.name: tasks
fields.documentation: Identifiers of tasks that can match the filter.

fields.name: services
fields.documentation: Identifiers of services. Tasks created by operations in these services match the filter (see {@link CommonInfo#service}).

fields.name: operations
fields.documentation:
Identifiers of operations. Tasks created by these operations match the filter (see {@link CommonInfo#operation}).

Note that an operation identifier by itself is not globally unique. To filter on an operation, the identifier of the service interface containing the operation should also be specified in {@name #services}.

fields.name: status
fields.documentation: Status that a task must have to match the filter (see {@link CommonInfo#status}).

fields.name: targets
fields.documentation: Identifiers of the targets the operation for the associated task created or was performed on (see {@link CommonInfo#target}).

fields.name: users
fields.documentation: Users who must have initiated the operation for the associated task to match the filter (see {@link CommonInfo#user}).

operations.name: get
operations.documentation: Returns information about a task.

params.name: task
params.documentation: Task identifier.

params.name: spec
params.documentation: Specification on what to get for a task.

errors.documentation: if the system reports an error while responding to the request.
if the task is not found.
if the task's state cannot be accessed.
if the system is unable to communicate with a service to complete the request.
if the user can not be authenticated.
if the user doesn't have the required privileges.

operations.name: list
operations.documentation: Returns information about at most 1000 visible (subject to permission checks) tasks matching the {@link FilterSpec}. All tasks must be in the same provider.

params.name: filter_spec
params.documentation: Specification of matching tasks.

params.name: result_spec
params.documentation: Specification of what to return for a task.

result.documentation: Map of task identifier to information about the task.

errors.documentation: if any of the specified parameters are invalid.
if a task's state cannot be accessed or over 1000 tasks matching the {@link FilterSpec}.
if the system is unable to communicate with a service to complete the request.
if the user can not be authenticated.
if the user doesn't have the required privileges.

operations.name: cancel
operations.documentation: Cancel a running operation associated with the task. This is the best effort attempt. Operation may not be cancelled anymore once it reaches certain stage.

params.name: task
params.documentation: Task identifier.

errors.documentation: if the system reports an error while responding to the request.
if the task is already canceled or completed.
if the task is not found.
if the task's state cannot be accessed.
if the system is unable to communicate with a service to complete the request.
if the user can not be authenticated.
if the user doesn't have the required privileges.
if the task is not cancelable.

packages.name: com.vmware.cis.task
packages.documentation: The {@name com.vmware.cis.task} {@term package} provides {@term enumerated types} and {@term structures} used for managing tasks.

enumerations.name: com.vmware.cis.task.status
enumerations.documentation: The {@name Status} {@term enumerated type} defines the status values that can be reported for an operation.

values.name: PENDING
values.documentation: The operation is in pending state.

structures.name: com.vmware.cis.task.progress
structures.documentation: The {@name Progress} {@term structure} contains information describe the progress of an operation.

fields.name: total
fields.documentation: Total amount of the work for the operation.

fields.name: completed
fields.documentation: The amount of work completed for the operation. The value can only be incremented.

fields.name: message
fields.documentation: Message about the work progress.

structures.name: com.vmware.cis.task.common_info
structures.documentation: The {@name CommonInfo} {@term structure} contains information common to all tasks.

fields.name: description
fields.documentation: Description of the operation associated with the task.

fields.name: service
fields.documentation: Identifier of the service containing the operation.

fields.name: operation
fields.documentation: Identifier of the operation associated with the task.

fields.name: parent
fields.documentation: Parent of the current task.

fields.name: target
fields.documentation: Identifier of the target created by the operation or an existing one the operation performed on.

fields.name: status
fields.documentation: Status of the operation associated with the task.

fields.name: cancelable
fields.documentation: Flag to indicate whether or not the operation can be cancelled. The value may change as the operation progresses.

fields.name: error
fields.documentation: Description of the error if the operation status is "FAILED".

fields.name: start_time
fields.documentation: Time when the operation is started.

fields.name: end_time
fields.documentation: Time when the operation is completed.

fields.name: user
fields.documentation: Name of the user who performed the operation.

structures.name: com.vmware.cis.task.info
structures.documentation: The {@name Info} {@term structure} contains information about a task.

fields.name: progress
fields.documentation: Progress of the operation.

fields.name: result
fields.documentation: Result of the operation. If an operation reports partial results before it completes, this {@term field} could be {@term set} before the {@link CommonInfo#status} has the value {@link Status#SUCCEEDED}. The value could change as the operation progresses.

fields.name: description
fields.documentation: Description of the operation associated with the task.

fields.name: service
fields.documentation: Identifier of the service containing the operation.

fields.name: operation
fields.documentation: Identifier of the operation associated with the task.

fields.name: parent
fields.documentation: Parent of the current task.

fields.name: target
fields.documentation: Identifier of the target created by the operation or an existing one the operation performed on.

fields.name: status
fields.documentation: Status of the operation associated with the task.

fields.name: cancelable
fields.documentation: Flag to indicate whether or not the operation can be cancelled. The value may change as the operation progresses.

fields.name: error
fields.documentation: Description of the error if the operation status is "FAILED".

fields.name: start_time
fields.documentation: Time when the operation is started.

fields.name: end_time
fields.documentation: Time when the operation is completed.

fields.name: user
fields.documentation: Name of the user who performed the operation.

enumerations.name: com.vmware.vcenter.lcm.appliance_size
enumerations.documentation: The size of appliance to be deployed.

values.name: TINY
values.documentation: Appliance size of 'tiny', Default vCPUs: 2, Memory: 8GB, VM: 100, Hosts: 10

values.name: SMALL
values.documentation: Appliance size of 'small', Default vCPUs: 4, Memory: 16GB, VM: 1000, Hosts: 100

values.name: MEDIUM
values.documentation: Appliance size of 'medium', Default vCPUs: 8, Memory: 24GB, VM: 4000, Hosts: 400

values.name: LARGE
values.documentation: Appliance size of 'large', Default vCPUs: 16, Memory: 32GB, VM: 10000, Hosts: 1000

values.name: XLARGE
values.documentation: Appliance size of 'extra large', Default vCPUs: 24, Memory: 48GB, VM: 35000, Hosts: 2000

enumerations.name: com.vmware.vcenter.lcm.appliance_type
enumerations.documentation: The type of appliance to be deployed.

enumerations.name: com.vmware.vcenter.lcm.storage_size
enumerations.documentation: The storage size of the appliance to be deployed.

structures.name: com.vmware.vcenter.lcm.ceip_only_sso
structures.documentation: The SSO definition that only contains CEIP setting.

fields.name: ceip_enabled
fields.documentation: This key describes the enabling option for the VMware's Customer Experience Improvement Program (CEIP). By default we have {@name #ceipEnabled}: true, which indicates that you are joining CEIP. If you prefer not to participate in the VMware's CEIP for this product, you must disable CEIP by setting {@name #ceipEnabled}: false. You may join or leave VMware's CEIP for this product at any time.

structures.name: com.vmware.vcenter.lcm.connection
structures.documentation: Connection information for source/destination location.

structures.name: com.vmware.vcenter.lcm.deployment_info
structures.documentation: Information about the appliance deployed.

fields.name: appliance_name
fields.documentation: The name of the appliance.

fields.name: appliance_fqdn
fields.documentation: The FQDN of the appliance.

fields.name: appliance_ips
fields.documentation: The ip addresses of the appliance.

structures.name: com.vmware.vcenter.lcm.deployment_option
structures.documentation: Container to control deployment.

values.name: SKIP_SSO_CHECK
values.documentation: Skips the sso check. This should only be used when performing precheck for install/upgrade of management node before infrastructure node is deployed.

fields.name: skip_options
fields.documentation: The options control if a task should be skipped.

structures.name: com.vmware.vcenter.lcm.destination_location

structures.name: com.vmware.vcenter.lcm.existing_migration_assistant
structures.documentation: Configuration of the migration assistant that is already running on the source Windows VC.

fields.name: ssl_thumbprint
fields.documentation: The SSL thumbprint of Migration Assistant.  The SSL thumbprint can be retrieved from the Migration Assistant console and log file.

fields.name: https_port
fields.documentation: Migration Assistant port number shown in the Migration Assistant console and log file. The default port is 9123.

structures.name: com.vmware.vcenter.lcm.external_tool
structures.documentation: Configuration of the external tools used.

fields.name: name
fields.documentation: The name of the external tool

fields.name: hostname
fields.documentation: The host name of the external tool.

fields.name: location
fields.documentation: The location of the external tool.

structures.name: com.vmware.vcenter.lcm.external_vcsa
structures.documentation: Configuration of the Single Sign-On for Management type deployment.

fields.name: active_directory_domain
fields.documentation: The name of the Active Directory domain to which the management node or VMC Gateway should be joined (for example: example.com). *Warning:* This attribute is part of a new feature in development. It may be changed at any time and may not have all supported functionality implemented.

fields.name: active_directory_username
fields.documentation: The username of the domain administrator in order to join the system to Active Directory. *Warning:* This attribute is part of a new feature in development. It may be changed at any time and may not have all supported functionality implemented.

fields.name: active_directory_password
fields.documentation: The password of the domain administrator in order to join the system to Active Directory. *Warning:* This attribute is part of a new feature in development. It may be changed at any time and may not have all supported functionality implemented.

fields.name: active_directory_organization_unit
fields.documentation: The organization unit to where the system should be added. *Warning:* This attribute is part of a new feature in development. It may be changed at any time and may not have all supported functionality implemented.

structures.name: com.vmware.vcenter.lcm.guest_credential
structures.documentation: Configuration of the guest credential.

fields.name: os_username
fields.documentation: Administrator username for the source Windows operating system.

fields.name: os_password
fields.documentation: Administrator user password for the source Windows operating system.

structures.name: com.vmware.vcenter.lcm.history
structures.documentation: Configuration of the data to be exported during upgrade/migrate.

enumerations.name: com.vmware.vcenter.lcm.history.data_set_type
enumerations.documentation: The type of data to be upgraded/migrated.

fields.name: defer_import
fields.documentation: A flag to indicate whether the import of historical data should be deferred until after upgrade/migrate.

fields.name: data_set
fields.documentation: The type of data to be upgraded/migrated.

structures.name: com.vmware.vcenter.lcm.migration_assistant
structures.documentation: Configuration of the migration assistant to be uploaded and started on source Windows VC.

fields.name: source_location
fields.documentation: The configuration to connect to an ESX/VC.

fields.name: settings
fields.documentation: Spec to automatically launch the Migration Assistant.

fields.name: guest_credentials
fields.documentation: Credentials for the Windows system on which the vCenter server is running.

fields.name: migration_assistant_installer_location
fields.documentation: Installer location of the migration assistant to be uploaded.

fields.name: migration_assistant_installer_location_ssl_verify
fields.documentation: A flag to indicate whether to verify ssl connection.

fields.name: migration_assistant_installer_location_ssl_thumbprint
fields.documentation: SSL thumbprint of the source appliance.

structures.name: com.vmware.vcenter.lcm.migration_assistant_setting
structures.documentation: Configuration of the setting of migration assistant to be uploaded and started on source Windows VC.

fields.name: migrated_ip
fields.documentation: The IP address of the network adapter that will be migrated. Only required if the Windows vCenter Server has multiple network adapters, making its system name resolve to multiple IP addresses.

fields.name: https_port
fields.documentation: Migration Assistant port number shown in the Migration Assistant console. The default port is 9123

fields.name: export_dir
fields.documentation: Directory to export source configuration and data. Optional.

fields.name: service_account_password
fields.documentation: The password of the vCenter Server service account. Required only if the vCenter Server service is running under a non LocalSystem account.

structures.name: com.vmware.vcenter.lcm.network
structures.documentation: Network configuration of the appliance to be deployed.

fields.name: time

fields.name: message
fields.documentation: The notification message.

fields.name: resolution

structures.name: com.vmware.vcenter.lcm.source_vc_windows
structures.documentation: Configuration of the source Windows VC.

fields.name: hostname
fields.documentation: The IP address or FQDN of the source Windows vCenter server to migrate. If an FQDN is provided, it must be resolvable from the machine that is running the installer.

fields.name: username
fields.documentation: Single Sign-On administrator user on the source Windows vCenter server. For example, administrator@vsphere.local. Important: The user must be administrator@your_domain_name.

fields.name: password
fields.documentation: The password of the Single Sign-On administrator on the source Windows vCenter server.

structures.name: com.vmware.vcenter.lcm.source_vum
structures.documentation: Configuration of the source VUM.

fields.name: hostname
fields.documentation: IP address or fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of the vSphere Update Manager host. If an FQDN is provided, it has to be resolvable from the machine that is running the installer.

fields.name: os_username
fields.documentation: Administrator username for the source vSphere Update Manager Windows operating system.

fields.name: os_password
fields.documentation: Administrator user password for the source vSphere Update Manager Windows operating system.

fields.name: export_dir
fields.documentation: Directory to export source configuration and data.

fields.name: port
fields.documentation: The port of the source vum.

fields.name: start_migration_assistant
fields.documentation: Configuration of migration assistant to be deployed to the vSphere Upgrade Manager.

fields.name: existing_migration_assistant

fields.name: installer_location

fields.name: installer_location_ssl_verify
fields.documentation: A flag to indicate whether to verify ssl connection of the location of the installer of migration assistant.

fields.name: installer_location_ssl_thumbprint
fields.documentation: SSL thumbprint of the location of the installer of migration assistant.

operations.name: check$task
operations.documentation: Performs a precheck for the given specification. The result of this operation can be queried by calling the cis/tasks/{task-id} with the task-id in the response of this call.

params.name: spec
params.documentation: The specification of the deployment.

params.name: options
params.documentation: The deployment precheck options.

errors.documentation: If the given spec and/or option contains error.

operations.name: start$task
operations.documentation: Deploys the appliance for the given specification. The result of this operation can be queried by calling the cis/tasks/{task-id} with the task-id in the response of this call.

params.name: spec
params.documentation: The specification of the deployment.

errors.documentation: If the given specification contains error.

services.name: com.vmware.vcenter.lcm.log
services.documentation: The service that provides logs associated with a task of a given task ID.

operations.name: get
operations.documentation: Retrieves the zipped files that contains operation log, serialized task flow, record of all configuration, and a current status of the operation.

params.name: task_id
params.documentation: The {@link ID} of the operation. must exist in the server. If for any reason the server reboots during an operation, all {@link ID}s previously stored is lost.

result.documentation: A zipped file that contains the files mentioned above.

errors.documentation: If the given ID does not exist in the server. There might be a cause of task ID does not exist including, error in taskID, or log files been purged by system or manually.

services.name: com.vmware.vcenter.lcm.migrate
services.documentation: The service to migrate a windows VC to Embedded VCSA, PSC, and Management VCSA.

structures.name: com.vmware.vcenter.lcm.migrate.migrate_destination_appliance
structures.documentation: Spec to describe the new appliance.

fields.name: appliance_name
fields.documentation: The name of the appliance to deploy.

fields.name: appliance_type
fields.documentation: The type of appliance to deploy.

fields.name: appliance_size
fields.documentation: A size descriptor based on the number of virtual machines which will be managed by the new vCenter appliance.

fields.name: appliance_disk_size
fields.documentation: The disk size of the new vCenter appliance.

fields.name: root_password
fields.documentation: Password must conform to the following requirements: 1. At least 8 characters. 2. No more than 20 characters. 3. At least 1 uppercase character. 4. At least 1 lowercase character. 5. At least 1 number. 6. At least 1 special character (e.g., '!', '(', '@', etc.). 7. Only visible A-Z, a-z, 0-9 and punctuation (spaces are not allowed)

fields.name: thin_disk_mode
fields.documentation: Whether to deploy the appliance with thin mode virtual disks.

fields.name: ova_location
fields.documentation: The location of the OVA file.

fields.name: ova_location_ssl_verify
fields.documentation: A flag to indicate whether the ssl verification is required.

fields.name: ova_location_ssl_thumbprint
fields.documentation: SSL thumbprint of ssl verification. If provided, ssl_verify can be omitted or set to true. If omitted, ssl_verify must be false. If omitted and ssl_verify is true, an error will occur.

fields.name: ovftool_location
fields.documentation: The location of the OVF Tool.

fields.name: ovftool_location_ssl_verify
fields.documentation: Flag to indicate whether or not to verify the SSL thumbprint of OVF Tool location.

fields.name: ovftool_location_ssl_thumbprint
fields.documentation: SSL thumbprint of OVF Tool location to be verified.

fields.name: active_directory_domain
fields.documentation: The name of the Active Directory domain to which the source Windows installation is joined. If the source Windows installation is not joined to an Active Directory domain, omit this parameter.

fields.name: active_directory_username
fields.documentation: Administrator user name of the Active Directory domain to which the source Windows installation is joined. The format can be either 'username' or 'username@domain'

fields.name: active_directory_password
fields.documentation: Password for the active directory user.

fields.name: services
fields.documentation: Spec to configure vCenter server services.

fields.name: temporary_network
fields.documentation: The network settings of the appliance to be deployed.

fields.name: history
fields.documentation: History data to be included in the upgrade and migrate

fields.name: ovftool_arguments
fields.documentation: The OVF Tool arguments to be included.

fields.name: vcsa_embedded
fields.documentation: Spec used to configure an embedded vCenter Server. This field describes how the embedded vCenter Server appliance should be configured.

fields.name: psc
fields.documentation: Spec used to configure a Platform Services Controller. This section describes how the Platform Services Controller appliance should be configured.  If unset, either {@name #vcsaEmbedded} or {@name #vcsaExternal} must be provided.

structures.name: com.vmware.vcenter.lcm.migrate.spec
structures.documentation: Spec to describe the configuration parameters that are required for migrating a Windows vCenter Server.

fields.name: destination_location
fields.documentation: This subsection describes the ESX or VC on which to deploy the appliance.

fields.name: destination_appliance
fields.documentation: Spec to describe the new appliance.

fields.name: source_vc_windows
fields.documentation: Spec to describe the existing Windows vCenter server to migrate.

fields.name: existing_migration_assistant
fields.documentation: Spec to describe the attributes of a running Migration Assistant on the Windows vCenter server.

fields.name: start_migration_assistant
fields.documentation: Spec to automate the invocation of Migration Assistant. Automatic invocation works only if the source Windows installation is running as a virtual machine.

fields.name: source_vum_location
fields.documentation: The configuration to connect to an ESX/VC.

fields.name: source_vum
fields.documentation: This section describes the source vSphere Update Manager (VUM) which you want to upgrade.

operations.name: check$task
operations.documentation: Performs a precheck for the given specification. The result of this operation can be queried by calling the cis/tasks/{task-id} with the task-id in the response of this call.

params.name: spec
params.documentation: The specification of the deployment.

params.name: options
params.documentation: The deployment precheck options.

errors.documentation: If the given spec and/or option contains error.

operations.name: start$task
operations.documentation: Deploys the appliance for the given specification. The result of this operation can be queried by calling the cis/tasks/{task-id} with the task-id in the response of this call.

params.name: spec
params.documentation: The specification of the deployment.

errors.documentation: If the given specification contains error.

fields.name: ova_location
fields.documentation: The location of the ova file.

fields.documentation: Spec to describe the attributes of a running Migration Assistant on the Windows vCenter server.

fields.name: start_migration_assistant
fields.documentation: Spec to automate the invocation of Migration Assistant. Automatic invocation works only if the source Windows installation is running as a virtual machine.

fields.name: source_vum_location
fields.documentation: The configuration to connect to an ESX/VC.

fields.name: source_vum
fields.documentation: This section describes the source vSphere Update Manager (VUM) which you want to upgrade.

fields.name: source_location

fields.name: source_appliance

fields.documentation: The configuration to connect to an ESX/VC.

structures.name: com.vmware.vcenter.lcm.recommendation.datastore_request
structures.documentation: The request for recommending datastore.

structures.name: com.vmware.vcenter.lcm.recommendation.datastore_destination_appliance
structures.documentation: The configuration of destination appliance to recommend datastore.

fields.name: ova_location
fields.documentation: The location of the ova file.

structures.name: com.vmware.vcenter.lcm.recommendation.datastore_info
structures.documentation: Datastore space information. Space information are in GB unit.

fields.name: freespace
fields.documentation: The amount of space that the datastore currently has.

fields.name: freespace_after_placement
fields.documentation: The amount of space that the datastore will have after deployment.

fields.name: required_space
fields.documentation: The amount of space that the deployment will occupy.

operations.name: scan_migrate_deployment_size$task
operations.documentation: Recommend deployment sizes based on the configuration given in the specification.

params.name: spec
params.documentation: The specification that contains information needed to recommend deloyment size.

result.documentation: A task-id associated with this task.

operations.name: scan_datastore$task
operations.documentation: Recommend a datastore for the appliance to be deployed in.

params.name: spec
params.documentation: The specification contains the information needed to recommend datastore

result.documentation: A task-id associated with this task.

operations.name: scan_upgrade_deployment_size$task
operations.documentation: Recommend deployment sizes based on the configuration given in the specification.

params.name: spec
params.documentation: The specification that contains information needed to recommend deloyment size.

result.documentation: A task-id associated with this task.

services.name: com.vmware.vcenter.lcm.restore
services.documentation: The {@name Restore} {@term service} retrieves backup metadata from backup location.

structures.name: com.vmware.vcenter.lcm.restore.backup_info
structures.documentation: The {@name BackupInfo} {@term structure} contains information about the backed up vCenter Server.

fields.name: build_number
fields.documentation: Build Number.

fields.name: version
fields.documentation: Version.

fields.name: pnid
fields.documentation: PNID.

fields.name: dc_port
fields.documentation: reverse proxy port.

fields.name: domain_name
fields.documentation: Domain Name.

fields.name: node_type
fields.documentation: Node type

fields.name: backup_time
fields.documentation: Backup time

fields.name: ssh_status
fields.documentation: SSH status.

fields.name: encrypted
fields.documentation: Backup Encryption status.

fields.name: backup_description
fields.documentation: Backup Description.

fields.name: deployment_size
fields.documentation: Deployment size.

structures.name: com.vmware.vcenter.lcm.restore.backup_metadata_location_spec
structures.documentation: The {@name BackupMetadataLocationSpec} {@term structure} contains information related to backup location.

fields.name: backup_location
fields.documentation: backup location.

fields.name: username
fields.documentation: username of backup location.

fields.name: password
fields.documentation: passowrd of backup location.

operations.name: retrieve_backup_metadata
operations.documentation: API to  return backup metadata from backup location (SMB/NFS) to perform recovery pre-check

params.name: spec
params.documentation: This includes backup location, username and password

result.documentation: backup meta data spec, to validate the recovery workflow.

errors.documentation: if arguments passed are invalid.
if the backup-metadata.json is not found or not accessible.
if the backup sever is not accessible with provided credentials.
if passed share protocol is invalid. Example : any protocol other than SMB/NFS.

operations.name: check_appliance_name$task
operations.documentation:
Validate the name of the appliance to be deployed.
  1. 1. Return False if the there is already an appliance that has the same name as given in the spec exist in the path.

params.name: spec
params.documentation: The configuration needed to validate the name of the appliance to be deployed.

result.documentation: False if the name of the appliance already exists. True otherwise.

operations.name: check_os_password$task
operations.documentation:
Validate if the given password conforms password policy.
  1. 1. Return False if the password in the spec violates password policy

params.name: spec
params.documentation: The configuration needed to validate the given password against password policy.

result.documentation: True if the password conforms password policy. False otherwise.

operations.name: check_network$task
operations.documentation:
Check to see if the given network configuration is valid.
  1. 1. Return False if the given network will cause conflict.
  2. 2. Always return True if network mode is set to DHCP.

params.name: spec
params.documentation: The configuration needed to validate network.

result.documentation: True if the network configuration is valid. False otherwise.

operations.name: check_host_config$task
operations.documentation:
Validate the host configuration.
  1. 1. Return False if the provided appliance type, appliance size, and disk size combination is not valid.
  2. 2. Return False if the provided deployment path does not have sufficient memory allocated.
  3. 3. Return False if the provided deployment path does not have sufficient cpu allocated.
  4. 3. Return False if the provided deployment path does not have sufficient datastore space.

params.name: spec
params.documentation: The configuration needed to validate host configuration.

result.documentation: True if the host configuration is valid, False otherwise.

operations.name: check_destination_location$task
operations.documentation: Validate the ESX of the appliance to be deployed.

params.name: spec
params.documentation: The configuration needed to validate the ESX of the appliance to be deployed.

result.documentation: True if the ESX of the appliance to be deployed is valid. False otherwise.

operations.name: check_temporary_network$task
operations.documentation:
Check to see if the given network configuration is valid.
  1. 1. Return False if the given network will cause conflict.
  2. 2. Always return True if network mode is set to DHCP.

params.name: spec
params.documentation: The configuration needed to validate network.

result.documentation: True if the network configuration is valid. False otherwise.

operations.name: check_source_vum$task
operations.documentation: Validate the source VUM configuration.

params.name: spec
params.documentation: The configuration needed to validate the source VUM.

result.documentation: True if the given source VUM configuration is valid. False otherwise.

operations.name: check_upgrade_source_appliance$task
operations.documentation:
Validate the source appliance to be upgraded.
  1. 1. Return False if the provided source appliance credentials are incorrect
  2. 2. Return False if the provided source location credentials are incorrect.
  3. 3. Return False if upgrade runner precheck results in error.
  4. 4. Return False if export directory provided is invalid.

params.name: spec
params.documentation: The configuration of the source appliance to be upgraded.

result.documentation: True if the given source appliance configuration is valid. False otherwise.

operations.name: check_migrate_source_appliance$task
operations.documentation:
Validate the source appliance to be migrated.
  1. 1. Return False if the provided source windows vc credentials are incorrect
  2. 2. Return False if migration assistant precheck results in error.

params.name: spec
params.documentation: The configuration of the source appliance to be migrated.

result.documentation: True if the given source appliance configuration is valid. False otherwise.
